intro: Eriocaulon distichoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in two rows along the stem. Eriocaulon distichoides is often found in temperate regions and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
